Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap

Class SimpleColorMap

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.colormap.SimpleColorMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
ColorMap
public class SimpleColorMap extends Object implements ColorMap
Maps numerical values in some range to colors using interpolation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SimpleColorMap()
    Constructs a ColorMap that gradiates from black to white.
    SimpleColorMap​(double minValue, double maxValue, Color minColor, Color maxColor)
    Constructs a ColorMap that gradiates from minValue -> minColor to maxValue -> maxColor.
    SimpleColorMap​(Color[] colorTable, double[] values)
    Constructs a ColorMap that matches the given double values with the given colors; in other words, any value passed to getColor(value) will be interpolate based on ranges defined by attaching these values to colors to make ColorRanges.
    SimpleColorMap​(Color[] colorTable, double minValue, double maxValue)
    Constructs a ColorMap that interpolates between the colors in colorTable for a data set in [minValue, maxValue].

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleColorMap

      public SimpleColorMap()
      Constructs a ColorMap that gradiates from black to white. Values higher than 1.0 are mapped to white. Values less than 0.0 are mapped to black. Values from 0.0 through 1.0 are considered valid values by validValue(...).

    • SimpleColorMap

      public SimpleColorMap​(double minValue, double maxValue, Color minColor, Color maxColor)
      Constructs a ColorMap that gradiates from minValue -> minColor to maxValue -> maxColor. Values higher than maxValue are mapped to maxColor. Values less than minValue are mapped to minColor. Values from minValue through maxValue are considered valid values by validValue(...).

    • SimpleColorMap

      public SimpleColorMap​(Color[] colorTable, double[] values)
      Constructs a ColorMap that matches the given double values with the given colors; in other words, any value passed to getColor(value) will be interpolate based on ranges defined by attaching these values to colors to make ColorRanges.
      Parameters:
      colorTable - - Colors to interpolate between
      values - - values corresponding to each color in the colorTable.

    • SimpleColorMap

      public SimpleColorMap​(Color[] colorTable, double minValue, double maxValue)
      Constructs a ColorMap that interpolates between the colors in colorTable for a data set in [minValue, maxValue].

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public Color getColor​(double value)
      Returns the Color representation of a particular floating point value for this ColorMap.
      Specified by:
      getColor in interface ColorMap

    • interpolateColor

      public static Color interpolateColor​(double interp, Color col1, Color col2)
      Given a double in [0,1], computes an Color interpolated between [col1, col2].
      Parameters:
      interp - - value representing location along gradient between [col1, col2]
      col1 - - lower bound of color gradient
      col2 - - upper bound of color gradient
      Returns:
      - java.awt.Color interpolated between [col1,col2] by the value of interp

      public boolean validValue​(double value)
      Checks if value is in [minValue, maxValue].

    • getAlpha

      public int getAlpha​(double value)
      Description copied from interface: ColorMap
      Returns the alpha value for a color for the given value. This could be simply written as return getRGB(value) >>> 24 or return getColor(value).getAlpha()
      Specified by:
      getAlpha in interface ColorMap

    • makeExamples

      public static void makeExamples​(int width, int height, String filePath)
      Creates .png files of every Color[] in the ColorGradient enum with horizontal (bar) striping.
      Parameters:
      width - - width of each png image. This is divided so that each color gets width/numColors amount of pixels across.
      height - - height of each png image.
      filePath - - path of the resulting image; each image will be called .png.
